headline.main: Obama to Take 1 Last Flight on Air Force 1 as Ex-President
headline.print_headline: Obama to Take 1 Last Flight on Air Force 1 as Ex-President

docs.lead_paragraph: He won't be president anymore, but Barack Obama will take one last flight on the presidential plane next week before handing it over to Donald Trump.
docs.snippet: He won't be president anymore, but Barack Obama will take one last flight on the presidential plane next week before handing it over to Donald Trump....

headline.main: Obama Health Law Posts Solid Sign-Ups Despite GOP Repeal Vow
headline.print_headline: Obama Health Law Posts Solid Sign-Ups Despite GOP Repeal Vow

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress may be moving to repeal "Obamacare," but millions of people are still signing up. The administration said Tuesday that 11.5 million enrolled nationwide through Dec. 24, ahead of last year's pace.

headline.main: John Kerry, in a Final, Pointed Plea, Will Outline a Vision of Mideast Peace
headline.print_headline: Kerry to Outline Vision of Israeli-Palestinian Accord

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from Mumbai.

docs.abstract: Sec of State John Kerry prepares final bid for Israeli-Palestinian peace accord in speech that will build on 2014 failed attempt and include subtle rebuke of Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu; remarks follow Israeli outrage over United States abstention from United Nations resolution denouncing Israel's ongoing building of West Bank settlements.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Kerry will use his remarks to confront Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel after bitterness over a United Nations resolution, a State Department official said.
docs.snippet: Mr. Kerry will use his remarks to confront Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel after bitterness over a United Nations resolution, a State Department official said....

headline.main: As Obama Accomplished Policy Goals, His Party Floundered
headline.print_headline: As Obama Accomplished Policy Goals, His Party Floundered

docs.lead_paragraph: In boasting about his tenure in the White House, President Barack Obama often cites numbers like these: 15 million new jobs, a 4.9 percent unemployment rate and 74 months of consecutive job growth.

headline.main: Obama Watchdog in Congress Has New Target in Trump Era: Postal Reform

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN, JENNIFER STEINHAUER and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Jason Chaffetz, once a dogged pursuer of President Obama and Hillary Clinton, has decided his House oversight committee has other priorities with a Republican in the White House.

headline.main: After Election, Commander in Chief Soothes White House Workers
headline.print_headline: Obama Plays  Consoler to a Staff Feeling Loss

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Obama told his dejected staff members: “You don’t need hope when things are going well. You need it when things are not going well.”
docs.snippet: Mr. Obama told his dejected staff members: “You don’t need hope when things are going well. You need it when things are not going well.”...

headline.main: Europeans View Obama’s Exit With a Mix of Admiration and Regret
headline.print_headline: Europeans View Obama’s Exit With Mix of Admiration and Regret

docs.lead_paragraph: While the president remains popular, there is disappointment in his failures, coupled with criticism that his caution may have contributed to Europe’s problems now.
